author: svantetobias
content: What are the possibilities for making a stake portable in phase 0? Can I deposit from a Eth1 smart contract address and have some simple logic for changing owner of the smart contract?

author: svantetobias
content: Or is it not possible because the stake withdrawal is tied to the BLS pub key and the priv key can't be stored in a smart contract?

author: bitfalls
content: ^ this. Technically, you can sell access to the withdrawal key, but since we don't even fully know what HD approach we'll take in eth2, it's tough to be certain about anything. It'll be possible and much easier later once smart contracts and multi sigs are up and running on eth2, but...

author: bitfalls
content: But for now, there's no way to change ownership other than flat out private key selling, sorry to disappoint ðŸ˜„

author: svantetobias
content: Sorry for the newbie questions. Reading the Transfer function code (which I understand will become available in phase 1), it looks to me that only non-staking bETH can be transferred. And as I understand it, re-staking bETH will not be available until phase 2. Is this correct?

author: djrtwo
content: selling private keys is ill-advised as the original owner can easily not destroy

author: djrtwo
content: You can re-stake eth via a transfer to a new validator. You can make a deposit as a new validator of hte minimum deposit size (1 eth), and transfer 31 eth that was already exited to the 1 eth validator, meeting the 32 eth minimum requirement and entering staking

author: svantetobias
content: Thanks, that makes sense! And we are talking from phase 1 and forward, correct?

author: djrtwo
content: It is likely that transfers are enabled at either phase 1 or some intermediate fork in between
